oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Transcriptome assessment of healthy highrisk stocker cattle defines mechanisms of inflammatory regulation induced by tulathromycin metaphylaxis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ramirez, B.
Crosby, W.
Woolums, A.
Karisch, B.
Scott, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tulathromycin is commonly used as metaphylaxis to reduce bovine respiratory disease (BRD) risk. Current secondary phar­macodynamics characteristics of tulathromycin on the host are poorly understood. RNA Sequencing (RNA-Seq) techniques were used to measure gene expression in healthy cattle admin­istered tulathromycin to elucidate the genomic mechanisms over time.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 56 (2023): 2023 Annual Conference Proceedings ; 193
